page.title: 09EATING AND DRINKING
page.content: In a survey into the eating and drinking preferences of a group of 9-10 year old children the following results were noticed.The favourite breakfast was cereals,with cornflakes being the most popular.No-one had any form of cooked breakfast.Surprisingly perhaps, roast lamb was the most popular meat,followed closely by roast pork and chicken.Beef burgers and sausages received very few votes. Carrots were the favourite vegetable with only 4% liking a green vegetable. Cucumber was top among salad vegetables but only just. Apples and grapes were equally favourite fruits, with numerous other fruits receiving a few votes each.Mars bars were the favourite sweet.Only two drinks received consideration,fizzy drinks (e.g. Coke and Lemonade)taking 95% of the votes,the rest going for milk.
